incidents.name: Users hitting 504s when accessing Quality Classic application

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've received reports of users hitting 504 errors when trying to access the Quality Classic application. We're currently investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.

We've identified the issue and implemented a fix. During this time, users may continue to experience delays in analysis while the system catches up. Additionally, if you notice that a Code Climate commit status is stuck in a yellow state, please push up a new commit.
We are investigating an issue with our database cluster used for Quality Analysis.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We've identified and resolved an issue with our analysis system. Users may experience slight delays in CI status checks.
This incident has been resolved.
The upstream provider has implemented a fix and analysis delays should begin to resolve. We're continuing to monitor.
Due to an ongoing issue with an upstream provider, some users may be experiencing delays in analysis. We're monitoring the situation.
Due to an ongoing issue with an upstream provider, some users may be experiencing delays in analysis. We're monitoring the situation.

The issue causing analysis delays due to upstream service issues has been resolved. Users should now experience normal processing times for analysis results.

We will continue to monitor for any further issues.

Due to an upstream service currently experiencing issues, some users may continue to experience delayed analysis results.

We are monitoring https://www.githubstatus.com/ for updates.
We are currently investigating an issue related to analysis delays.
This incident has been resolved.
After intervention, the code coverage processing time has increased and is now normal. We are operational and continuing to monitor.
We are currently investigating an internal alarm related to delays of processing code coverage results for some users.

incidents.name: Elevated errors in Velocity API and Velocity Web Application

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved
We are seeing an elevated rate of errors in the Velocity API and Velocity Web Application. Our Engineering team is currently investigating the cause of the errors.
This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been resolved
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We have observed that one of our Git servers is experiencing difficulties in carrying out its usual activities. A small portion of users may encounter high latency during the analysis of pull requests.
This incident has been resolved.

Users should no longer be experiencing hanging Quality statuses on newly opened pull requests. However, some users may continue to observe hanging Quality statuses on pull requests opened > 1-hour ago. In those cases, pushing a fresh commit should rectify the issue. We'll continue to monitor.
We've identified the issue and implemented a remediation. We're continuing to monitor and will provide additional information shortly.
We've received reports that some users may be experiencing hanging builds on pull requests opened today. We're investigating and will provide more information as soon as possible.

incidents.name: [Quality] Reports of users hitting 500s when trying to view repositories

incident_updates.body: We put in place a remediation that mitigates users hitting 500s when accessing their repositories on Quality. We'll continue to monitor.
We've received reports of some users hitting 500s when trying to view their repositories on Quality. We're investigating and will provide more information as soon as possible.
This incident has been resolved.
We implemented a fix and analysis times should begin to decrease for most users. We're continuing to monitor.
We've identified an issue which is causing delays in Quality analysis for some users. We're in the process of implementing a fix.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: We're currently investigating issues with analysis.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We're continuing to investigate site-wide issues with Quality at the moment. During this time, users may experience intermittent 500s when loading the app as well as delayed analysis.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We've detected some issues with performing analysis on some of the repositories in Quality. We are investigating the cause now and will keep you updated as things develop.

incidents.name: Test coverage reports may be failing to be received

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We received customer reports experiencing 500 error responses when uploading coverage information. We are investigating.
This incident has been resolved.
We have noted an increase in the mean time associated with Quality Analysis. We are presently undertaking a comprehensive investigation to determine the underlying cause.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates in the Velocity API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified and fixed the issue. All API endpoints are now working as expected.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating elevated levels of errors in the Velocity API
This incident has been resolved.

We've identified the issue as having to do with our data processing infrastructure and are in the process of rolling out a fix to account for this. Users during this time might notice a delay in analysis but should be back to normal shortly.
We are noticing a spike in issues with Quality Analysis and are investigating what the issue might be.

incidents.name: Quality app experiencing issues loading and performing analysis

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue appears to be related to a recent DNS change internally. We have deployed a fix and are monitoring to make sure everything is working as expected.
We are currently investigating this issue.
